abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Albania Integrated Water Ecosystem Management Project
            outlines expected negative environmental impacts and
            proposed mitigations. To ensure maintenance of water
            quality, levels, and water flows, as well as ecological
            balance, specific indices will be monitored periodically.
            Also to reduce the risk of water contamination, protect the
            constructed treatment wetlands (CTW) by a flood protection
            dyke; remove topsoil before construction and substitute
            impervious clay liners to protect groundwater; and follow
            procedures for sludge removal and disposal. To protect
            biodiversity, habitats, and rare species, prepare a
            comprehensive monitoring program and set guidelines for
            contractors. No significant increase in mosquitoes is
            expected, so the risk of malaria is low. Mitigations
            comprise a management plan that combines biological and
            chemical control measures; and creating buffer zones with
            greenbelts around all sites. To control the social risk
            associated with odors emanating from wetlands when waters
            begin to stagnate, elaborate a plan for water control
            measures to avoid putrification; and create buffer zones. An
            environmental management plan will address reducing the
            impact of the silt clay or clay sand material extraction for
            CTW embankments or excavation deposits.
